Hello Just Wanted to Tell You About A Glass Club Meeting In Greenwood IN. In Early April 6&7, 2012. For More Information Call Me at 317-640-2874 Spring is in the Air and Just to Update I Am Still Working on the Picture Process, Thanks from Larre ---- Just to keep you informed I am still working on the picture part of the book. I still have many pictures to take and I want to have as many pictures in the book as possible. The basic book is done as far as a the main body of the book, the index and the table of contents are done, there are at this time 407 single pages that will be edited down to 300 plus pages. I will have information about getting a book on this page, when it is published. Have a message to post, please leave it on my blog board . There is also a new page for glasses that I will be selling or trading. If you are interested in buying any glasses listed on my buy and sell page please contact me at eckglass59@aol.com , eckglass@aol.com with the glass name and number. Thanks
I have added a web store but can only list 5 items at a time right now, please check out my web store, Thanks
________________________________________________________________________________
Hello, I will be selling advertising space in this book for more information please contact me at, eckglass59@aol.com .
Yo u can buy space in the front, middle or back of the book. A whole page is required and can be in black&white or color. All advertising must be associated with glass collecting. Thanks
_______________________________________________________________________
Want to see another sample page? Visit my guestbook and let me know what you would like to see. Thanks Larre
The All New Glass Collectors Price Guide for 2007
L . Eckert's
Price Guide&Inventory Book
A Guide to Drinking Glasses
Promotional - Advertising - Character
The Most Comprehensive Glass Book
Ever Published Over 20,000 Entries
by Larre Eckert
First Edition
Pepsi , Coca Cola, 7 Up , Root Beer, Disney, Kentucky Derby,
Preakness, Belmont Stakes, Measuring, Big Top Peanut Butter,
European Mustard, Welchs Jelly, Australian, South American,
NASCAR, Budweiser, Miller, McDonalds, Burger King, Dairy,
Newspaper Headlines, State, Fanta, Burger Chef, Arbys, Nutella,
O l y m p i c s , RC Cola, Amusement Park, Warner Brothers, Western,
Taco Bell, KFC, Bama Jelly, World Cup Soccer and Zodiac
L. Eckert Publications
Glass Book Information and Contents
Well the long awaited newest and most comprehensive Cartoon, Advertising and Characters glass book will be published soon. I have spent years collecting the contents of this book there is no other list of glasses as comprehensive as the listings in this book. I have listed thousands of different catagories and added a synopsis of each of the catagories so that collectors and novices will better understand where, why and how these glasses were manufactured and issued. I have numbered each glass with its own number, no glass has the same number. I have included for the benefit of the collector and sellers a line behind the glass number to keep track of their inventory or keep track of glasses that may have been sold. I have numbered these glasses in a manner that no other book has numbered glasses. I have listed the glasses by the soda logo first, meaning if the glass has a soda logo you will find it listed under the perspective soda. If you have used the other books my system will take some getting used to, but once you master the system I think it will work efficiently.
Back to the book and it's author, my name is Larre Eckert and I have been collecting glasses since 1971, that's when I guess I really got my first glasses, they were a Grecian type glass and came in different sizes, they were at Marathons, buy some gas and get a glass. Next were the BC Comics glasses, the black and white ones with frosted pitchers, cookie jars and bowls (I have them all of course). Then the restaurants went big issuing glasses in the early seventies. In the early 70's Warner Brother's, MGM, Walter Lantz, and Hanna Barbara authorized glasses with their characters and a Pepsi logo, thousands of these glasses were issued nation wide. Then sports glasses really took off and again thousands of them were issued from just about every major sport. Jelly glasses have been around since the thirties but probably got more abundant in the seventies and eighties and are still being issued today. Today with the internet you can get glasses from almost anywhere in the world with just about any soda logo or character you want, you can get glasses on the internet anywhere from $0.01 a glass to as high as $10,000.00 a glass. Without leaving your home you can buy , sell, pay for and have shipped to your house just about any glass you want. There are several different glass collecting clubs that offer memberships and have meetings around the U.S. where you can buy, sell and trade glasses. Glasses that have been issued nationwide and locally show up at these meetings so it makes it easy to find more of these glasses. Some of these clubs offer new special issue glasses to their registered club members for a small price. I have belonged to some of these clubs and there are always hundreds of glasses at these meetings to buy, sell and trade. Now thirty six years later, after eating tons of fast food and burning up thousands of gallons of gas I have over 13,000 glasses in my collection.
In this new book you will find thousands of new glasses and categories listed, in some of the categories you will find hundreds of glasses listed that were not in previous books. An example of one of those categories is the measuring glasses, in this book I have listed approximately 726 different measuring glasses. The listing includes the advertisers and on most listings the colors and size of the glass. You will find most of the Kentucky Derby glasses, most of the Preakness glasses, most of the Belmont Stakes glasses and the Jim Beams Stakes glasses from Turfway Park in eastern Kentucky. Next you will find hundreds of foreign glasses, since the introduction of the internet, buying and locating glasses from all over the world has become a common event. There is a very large section of Nutella glasses from Europe and Australia. There is a section for Penotti glasses from Europe. As you are searching this book you will also find different categories and hundreds of glasses from countries like, Thailand, China, Belgium, England, Italy, different countries in the Middle East, Canada, Australia, Puerto Rico and different countries in South America. Search on further through the book you will find glasses from hundreds of different restaurants from around the world. Just to mention a few, McDonald's, Burger King, Burger Queen, Burger Chef, Taco Bell, Arby's, Hardee's, Kentucky Fried Chicken, Taco Tico, Elby's, Sonic, Dog&Suds, A&W Root Beer, Hard Rock Cafe's, Kelsey's, Ken's Pizza, Krystal's, White Castles, Dairy Queen, Pizza Hut, Clancey's, Don Cherry's, Bonanza's, Nathan's, Wendy's and hunderds of other restaurants. You are going to find glasses from Amusement Parks, Fairs, Gas Stations, Newspapers Companies, Jelly and Peanut Butter Distributors. As you keep looking you will see glasses with logos from Pepsi, Coca Cola, 7 Up, Sprite, and Dr Pepper. You are going to find glasses with almost every conceivable cartoon character you can think of, characters from, Warner Brother's, Disney, Newspaper Comics, McDonald's, Burger King, MGM, Hanna Barbara, Harvey Cartoons, Superheros, Star Trek, Star Wars and Borden's to mention a few. Want more categories, check out categories like Christmas, The Beatles, Elvis Presley, Holly Hobbie, Strawberry Shortcake, State Birds&Flowers, Dog glasses, NASCAR, Indianapolis 500, the Olympics, Budweiser, Miller, Circus glasses, Movies, and Sports glasses. There are hundreds of categories that have not been mentioned and will be a treat for you, when you find and see the categories in this book.
Using the Listing Section
As you search this book you will find the listings a little different from some of the previous books. The listings in this book are based on the logos, distributors and characters that are on the glasses. The soda logo on a glass has priority in the listing process it comes first, second would be the distributor and third would be the character. So, if you know the glass has a Pepsi logo, a Tim Horton's Donut logo and a Warner Brothers character you would look in Pepsi under a PET prefix. If it was Pepsi logo and a Warner Brother's character you would look under PEW. An example of this would be Pepsi glasses, all Pepsi glasses are listed in a Pepsi section, Coca Cola in a Coca Cola section and Disney in a Disney section. Lets go back to the Pepsi section, all glasses in this book are numbered with their own individual number. The prefix PEP for example could be for glasses issued from the PGCA Club, PEP070 would be for Pepsi and the third letter P for the first letter in the second word of the description which will then be followed by 3 numbers 070. There are no two glasses with the same prefix and number. All Pepsi glasses issued from the PGCA would be listed in that section or category.
The Line Behind the Glass Number
The next part we want to explain is the line behind the individual glass number PEP070 ____. This line is basically designed for the collectors, but can be used by sellers and buyers. It was designed to help the collectors keep track of which glasses or how many of each individual glass they have in their inventory. This feature helps when you are out shopping the Antique Malls, Flea Markets and Junk Shops. You can quickly check the listing to see if you need the glass or if you already have one or several in stock, there for keeping you from buying glasses you may not need. Sellers and buyers could use the line to keep track of how many of each glass they have bought or sold.
